page.title: 01AREA DESCRIPTION
page.content: Three sections emerge,1,Farmland and woodland,2,Brancepeth Village,3,West Brandon.The North east corner is almost entirely residential, a mixture of council and recently developed private estates.Council houses have been built since 1950 and private estates since 1974.Brancepeth lies astride the A690.Here private development has grown since 1975.The focal point is the castle.Farmland lies mostly on a south facing hill (600'_250') and is 50% arable 50% grazing.Most of the woodland is deciduous but there are some coniferous plantations.West of Brancepeth the valley slopes from 850'(west) to the floor(350') and rises to 500'(south east).
